description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment in (S96a) seeking to allow changes on the opening hours, in relation to planning permission reference 185939VAR dated 28/06/2019 for 'Application for Minor Material Amendment (s73) to vary conditions 2, 18, 19 and 22 of planning permission ref. 164015FUL dated 20.04.2017 as varied by ref. 173955VAR dated 28.02.2018 (and as amended by 182762NMA and 185450NMA) for Application for Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission ref. 164015FUL dated 20.04.2017 for Redevelopment of the site to provide a 5-22 storey perimeter building to accommodate commercial floorspace at ground floor (mixture of Land Use Classes D2, A1, A3, and B1) and 302 residential units, amenity space at 1st, 5th and 9th floors, car and cycle parking, refuse storage, vehicular access to the east of the site, landscaping and lighting. This variation seeks external alterations to Block C to insert five additional windows; revise internal layout to change unit tenure and reduce number of residential units by 5; and increase to affordable housing provision by 63 units, from 102 affordable units to 165 affordable units, by including provision from alternative site and a proposed uplift in affordable housing units.'
decision_conditions: The commercial unit hereby approved shall not be opened to customers other than between the hours of 0700 to 2300hrs Mondays to Sunday and public holidays. All activity shall cease 30 minutes after closing time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g) (j) and 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
